text: The 2023-24 FC Red Bull Salzburg season is the 91st season in the existence of FC Red Bull Salzburg and the club's 34th consecutive season in the top league of Austrian football. Salzburg also participated in this season's editions of the Austrian Cup and the UEFA Champions League. For the first time after 10 titels in a row Salzburg finished as second. In the Cup they reached the semifinals where they lost versus SK Sturm Graz which also won the league title. ==Squad== 2023/24 * Goalkeepers:13 Timo Horn, 24 Alexander Schlager, 41 Jonas Krumrey * Defenders: 3 Aleksa Terzic, 4 Kamil Piatkowski, 5 Bryan Okoh, 17 Andreas Ulmer, 22 Oumar Solet, 6 Samson Baidoo, 70 Amar Dedic, 31 Strahinja Pavlovic, 29 Daouda Guindo * Midfielders: 14 Maurits Kjaergaard, 10 Luka Sucic, 8 Dijon Kameri,27 Lucas Gourna-Douath, 36 Justin Omoregie, 44 Samson Tijani, 32 Amankwah Forson, 30 Oscar Gloukh, 18 Mads Bidstrup * Forwards: 20 Sekou Koita, 11 Fernando, 19 Karim Konate, 21 Petar Ratkov, 23 Roko Simic, 45 Dorgeles Nene * Gerhard Struber (head coach), Onur Cinel (caretaker since April 2024), Florens Koch, Alexander Hauser (assistant coaches), Herbert Ilsanker (goalkeeper coach) FC Salzburg Wiki ===Matches=== ==Champion group == ==Final table== Pl.
